programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: East rivals in the 76ers and Knicks start a two-game series at Madison Square Garden. New York won the first two meetings this season, both in Philadelphia, by a combined 50 points. Knicks guard Jalen Brunson totaled 50 points in those contests.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Timberwolves aim to claim the season series against the Lakers in this match. Minnesota took a pair of contests in Los Angeles' prior stomping grounds in December 2023. Wolves star Anthony Edwards averaged 29 points per game in those wins.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: Presenting the latest news from the world of sports.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 4 Red Wolves seek their second Sun Belt Tournament title as they play the No. 2 Dukes in the final. The Wolves won in 1999. Arkansas State ousted Appalachian State 67-65 in the semifinals on Freddy Hicks' jumper at the buzzer.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 Gaels begin their West Coast Conference Tournament with a semifinal showing against the No. 4 Broncos. Saint Mary's seeks a third straight trip to the WCC title game. Santa Clara put up 104 points in a quarterfinal win over No. 5 San Diego.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Nuggets look to keep rolling versus the Heat. Denver has won 11 of the last 12 meetings, with Miami's lone triumph coming in Game 2 of the 2023 NBA Finals. Michael Porter Jr.'s 30-point double-double spurred a 103-97 Nuggets victory Feb. 29.

programme.desc: Unique and compelling feature stories from the world of sports.

programme.title: Coach K & Roy Williams: Rivals Reunited
programme.desc: Two of the most successful NCAA basketball coaches in history, Mike Krzyzewski and Roy Williams, meet for a rare in-depth conversation, something they never did together during their coaching careers at Duke and North Carolina.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: A collection of fights that welcome fans back to arenas. Featuring Edson Barboza, Jeff Molina, and Dricus Du Plessis.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 4 Cyclones challenge the No. 1 Sooners in this Big 12 Tournament semifinal. Freshman center Audi Crooks' 23 points pushed Iowa State past No. 5 Baylor 67-62 in the quarterfinals, while Oklahoma took care of shorthanded No. 9 TCU 69-53.

programme.title: College Basketball Live Scoreboard
programme.desc: All the latest scores and highlights from college basketball.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 2 Longhorns and No. 3 Wildcats play a Big 12 Tournament semifinal. The teams split the yearly set, but Texas bested Kansas State without KSU star Ayoka Lee in the lineup. Lee double-doubled in KSU's quarterfinal win over No. 6 West Virginia.

programme.desc: From Harrah's Cherokee Center in Asheville, N.C.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 5 Norse and No. 6 Panthers meet in the Horizon League Tournament semifinals. Both schools pulled off quarterfinal upsets, with Northern Kentucky needing overtime to knock off No. 4 Wright State and Milwaukee dumping rival No. 3 Green Bay.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 2 Bulldogs and the No. 3 Dons do battle in a West Coast Conference Tournament semifinal. Gonzaga has won 27 straight meetings with San Francisco, including five tournament games with the most recent clash coming in last season's semifinal.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 seed Catamounts cruise into this America East Tournament semifinal against the No. 4 Wildcats. Vermont, the league champs in 2022 and 2023, has won 17 of its past 18 overall. Vermont has also won 18 of the last 19 versus New Hampshire.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 6 Seahawks try to upend the No. 2 Warriors in the Northeast Conference Tournament final. Merrimack, who wore the conference crown in 2023 but was not given an NCAA Tournament berth due to its transition to D-I, lost to Wagner on Jan. 25.

programme.desc: From T-Mobile Center in Kansas City, Mo.

At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Coach K & Roy Williams: Rivals Reunited
programme.desc: Two of the most successful NCAA basketball coaches in history, Mike Krzyzewski and Roy Williams, meet for a rare in-depth conversation, something they never did together during their coaching careers at Duke and North Carolina.

programme.title: THE MONSTER: Naoya Inoue
programme.desc: Japanese boxer Naoya Inoue is a three-weight world champion known for his power and devastating body attacks.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: Highlights of Teófimo López best matches.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: College Basketball Live Scoreboard
programme.desc: All the latest scores and highlights from college basketball.

programme.desc: Second Round.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 12 Fighting Illini (22-8, 13-6 Big Ten) complete their regular season by visiting the Hawkeyes (18-12, 10-9). Illinois got a 30-point outburst from Coleman Hawkins, a career high for the senior forward, in a 95-85 win over Iowa on Feb. 24.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: From Gainesville Raceway in Gainesville, Fla.

programme.title: NHRA in 30
programme.desc: In the fastest motorsport on earth, things don't always go as planned; relive the NHRA moments that grabbed our attention and see how they walked away.

programme.title: The American Rodeo
programme.desc: All the action from rodeo competitions.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Badgers (19-11, 11-8) seek revenge on the No. 3 Boilermakers (27-3, 16-3) in a Big Ten finale. Purdue dumped then-No. 6 Wisconsin 75-69 on Feb. 4. The Boilermakers, locked into the conference's top seed, look to polish off a perfect home record.

programme.title: I Am Kevin Harvick
programme.desc: The film chronicles legendary NASCAR champion and FOX Sports' newest NASCAR analyst Kevin Harvick, through his exhilarating racing career and beyond the finish line to unveil the story behind the iconic athlete.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Kyle Larson comes in hot as the NASCAR Cup Series heads to Phoenix for the Shriners Children's 500. Larson held off Tyler Reddick to win last week's Pennzoil 400 in Las Vegas. William Byron, who won the 2023 races in Las Vegas and Phoenix, was 10th.

programme.title: The Carton Show
programme.desc: Craig Carton, one of New York's best-known voices, analyzes and debates the biggest headlines in sports each morning.

programme.title: Undisputed
programme.desc: A daily sports talk show hosted by Skip Bayless, where each day Skip is joined by a cast of NFL legends for passionate conversations about the biggest sports topics of the day.

programme.title: The Herd With Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Colin Cowherd and co-host Jason McIntyre break down the biggest stories and interview the biggest guests in sports.

programme.desc: Nick Wright, Chris Broussard and Kevin Wildes explore and energetically advance the biggest stories in sports to start the day.

programme.desc: The No. 1 Huskies try to claim another Big East championship as they face the No. 6 Hoyas. UConn has won three straight Big East titles, has not lost a conference tournament game since 2013, and hasn't fallen against Georgetown since 1993.

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 Huskies continue their march by facing the No. 5 Golden Eagles in a Big East Tournament semifinal. UConn's quest for a 11th straight conference crown began with an 86-53 romp over No. 9 Providence. Marquette knocked out No. 4 Villanova.

programme.title: NASCAR Xfinity Racing Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Xfinity Series stays in the desert for the Call 811.com Every Dig. Every Time. 200. John Hunter Nemechek picked up his 10th career Series victory last week in Las Vegas. Sammy Smith took home the checkered flag in Phoenix in 2023.
